Parts of speech refer to words that are used to name and describe people, things, places, or events.
Preposition: Many people drive across the bridge daily.
Adjective: She is a young, beautiful girl.
Conjunction: I drink a lot of tea but I prefer coffee.
Noun: He used a corkscrew to open the wine bottle.
Verb: The man runs in the morning.
Possessive Adjective: They are walking their dogs.
Interjection: Hmm, let me think about this.
Adverb: The boy often reads the newspaper.
